name: Frequently Asked Questions - Intense Pulsed Light (IPL)

mainEntity.name: What is intense pulsed light (IPL) and how does it work?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Intense pulsed light (IPL) is a non-invasive medical treatment that uses high-intensity light pulses to treat various skin conditions. It works through the selective absorption of light by specific pigments, such as melanin or hemoglobin, allowing for the removal of spots, treatment of rosacea, and improvement of skin texture.
The Harmony XL Pro equipment incorporates advanced technology for greater precision and safety, achieving effective results with lower risk of adverse effects.

mainEntity.name: Is the intense pulsed light treatment painful?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Pulsed light treatment is usually not painful, but may generate a mild sensation of heat or itching on the skin. Thanks to the advanced technology of the Harmony XL Pro, the procedure is more comfortable and safer, as it has a cooling system that minimizes discomfort.
In sensitive skins, topical anesthesia can be applied for greater comfort.

mainEntity.name: How long do the results of intense pulsed light last?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Results can last between 6 months and 1 year, depending on the treated condition and aftercare.
To maintain long-term effects, daily use of sunscreen and maintenance sessions every 6 to 12 months are recommended.
